results.title: Event horse
results.creator_credit: Robin Crane Films and Robin Crane
results.brief_description: Based on Sheila Willcox’s book “The Event horse”. Tells the story of the training of a “green” horse up to the winning of a novice horse trial. Training technicalities are presented in an interesting way, and the whole story of training and competing is designed to give people a better understanding of the purpose and requirements of a horse trial.

results.title: Evening Care
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”.
Stresses the obligation of each hospital corpsman is to be cheerful and to make each patient comfortable. Demonstrates the alcohol rub which will prevent pressure sores.

results.title: Evening bell = Wang zhong [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: August First Film Studio and Wu Ziniu
results.brief_description: In China, shortly after the Japanese surrender at the end of World War II, a small group of Chinese soldiers encounter a large group of starving Japanese soldiers hiding in a remote cave. Cut off from outside contact, they do not know that the war is over. There follows a tense standoff, as the Chinese soldiers try, unsuccessfully, to convince the Japanese to surrender. This intense saga is conveyed in a taciturn, almost abstract, symmetrical style which never plays up the sensationalism of the subject nor privileges a particular point-of-view. Rather Ziniu lets the images provide eloquent testimony to the cruelty and violence that ensues. One of the 5th Generation of contemporary Chinese film directors, Wu Ziniu won the Silver Bear Award at the 19th Berlin International Film Festival for “Evening bell”. Cast includes Tao Zeru, Zhao Qi, Peipei Chong and Sun Min. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: Even the smallest change is a victory (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Gary Bictel, Joy Johnson and Lance Evoy
results.brief_description: Seven high school students discuss the inferior status of women and their limited rights in comparison to men. They question the ways in which men control, dominate and express themselves through competition and aggression. The group feels these existing attitudes must change.

results.title: Even more ripping yarns
results.brief_description: A compilation of three comic yarns starring Michael Palin. “Roger of the Raj” - A young man throws off the world of 18 course breakfasts and commits the most despicable act known to the British Army. Starring John Le Mesurier “Murder at Moorstones Manor” - A murder mystery that Agatha Christie never dared to write, everyone has a motive for the murders and they’re all intent on proving their own guilt. “Across the Andes by Frog” - The story of a pioneer and his frogs who set out to conquer the Andes. Starring Denholm Elliott.

results.title: Even cowgirls get the blues
results.creator_credit: New Line Cinema, Fourth Features, Laurie Parker and Gus Van Sant
results.brief_description: Even cowgirls get the blues is a comedy directed by Gus Van Sant (My own private Idaho, Psycho, Good Will Hunting, To die for), who also wrote the screenplay, from the Tom Robbins book of the same name. Uma Thurman stars as Sissy Hankshaw, a woman born with enormous thumbs, which leads her to believe that her destiny is to hitchhike around America, looking for some meaning in her life. Sissy is essentially a social outcast in search of a family who will accept her and her oversized thumbs. After spending time in New York as a model, Sissy finds herself at the Rubber Rose Ranch on an assignment, where she meets and falls in love with Bonanza Jellybean (Rain Phoenix). Jellybean is planning to take over the ranch from The Countess (John Hurt) and Miss Adrian (Angie Dickinson). The film is riddled with other subplots involving peyote, whooping cranes and a mountain-man prophet, The Chink (Pat Morita), with whom Sissy forms a relationship. Cast also includes Roseanne Arnold, Buck Henry, Sean Young, Crispin Glover, Keanu Reeves, Heather Graham and a cameo by William Burroughs. Author Tom Robbins provides a voice-over narration, reading prose from his book, “Even cowgirls get the blues”. Soundtrack by K.D. Lang.

results.title: Even cowboys
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School, Sue Byrne, Joanne Hamilton, Tanya Uren and Noellie Taylor
results.brief_description: A look at a travelling wild west routine that goes from the prosaic to the ridiculous. From Bendigo to Wangaratta and the potholes incurred when rivals come up against stiff opposition.

results.title: Even chance (A)
results.creator_credit: Curriculum Branch, Ministry of Ed, Victoria. Office of the Commissioner for Equal Opportunity, Sabina Baltrukomis and Martin Zierman
results.brief_description: Alice, a young Aboriginal woman, leaves her home in a country town to work in the city. She finds employment but things start to go wrong and eventually she is dismissed. Alice decides to take her case to the Office of the Commissioner for Equal Opportunity. The program highlights examples of harassment, prejudice, stereotyping and discrimination.

results.title: Eve Lambart
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Margaret Wescott and Edward Le Lorrain
results.brief_description: Film animator Eve Lambart spent over thirty years working at the National Film Board, and now she has retired. This retirement means many things to her: gardening, sewing, baking and preserving, weaving, and even filmmaking in her own animation studio during her “spare” time. Always an individualist, she is enjoying her self-contained new lifestyle to the fullest.

results.title: Eve Arnold in retrospect
results.creator_credit: Wonderland, BBC, Spencer Style and Beeban Kidron
results.brief_description: Eve Arnold, member of the celebrated Magnum photographic agency since 1957 is the subject of this informative documentary which looks not only at her work, but the influence her life experiences have had on her art. Her extensive portfolio of work includes many well known figures and has captured some of the centuries memorable moments. Subjects include; Margaret Thatcher, Malcolm X, Marilyn Monroe, Marlene Dietrich, Joan Crawford, plus many more celebrities, places and faces.
